metadata.titel_preek: Eleventh Sunday After Pentecost: Romans 8 / Trinity Sunday / Psalm 130

primair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: God, motivated by His own nature as self-giving love, pursues and redeems a humanity that is in a state of 'primordial catastrophe' and self-destruction.

subject.identificatie: The Triune God (Father, Son, Holy Spirit)
tekstueel_bewijs: God pursues us even beyond the grave
The love that persists in breaking through our resistance
He shall redeem Israel from all his iniquities

zender.identificatie: The Inner Life of the Trinity (Love as Essence)
tekstueel_bewijs: The inmost being of God is a dynamic interrelatedness that pours itself out
redeem Israel from all his iniquities

helper.identificatie: Jesus Christ (Incarnation/Blood) and the Holy Spirit
tekstueel_bewijs: God’s love spends itself to the very last drop of the blood of the Son
the love that has become incarnate in history through Jesus Christ

tegenstander.toelichting_ernst: Sin is described not as a mistake but as a 'catastrophe' and 'estrangement' that renders the human subject totally unable to stand.

secundair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: The human response of confession and worship as a result of being saved.
secundair_narratief_programma.subject: The Believer/Hearer
secundair_narratief_programma.toelichting_verhouding: Confession is the 'entrance' or 'path' made possible only because God is already the God of forgiveness.

actantieel_schema_visualisatie.zender_naar_ontvanger: Trinitarian Love → Redemption → The Miserable Offender

voorbeelden_god_subject: God pursues us even beyond the grave
voorbeelden_mens_subject: the psalmist ceases to reflect upon himself

voorbeelden: things which we ought to have done
you would do anything... to reverse the situation
discovery that he is a God of infinite mercy
total inability to present ourselves righteous
God who pursues us... with his resurrection power

modale_analyse.modale_interpretatie: The sermon emphasizes human 'non-pouvoir' (inability) and God's 'pouvoir' (resurrection power), a classic grace structure.

semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.beweging_in_preek: Moves from S2 (Depths) to ~S2 (Honest confession) to S1 (Grace).
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.theologische_resolutie: The tension is resolved by the character of God (S1) which is independent of human merit (~S1).
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.ernst_van_s2: High; S2 is described as a primordial catastrophe.

diagnostische_evaluatie.classificatie_toelichting: The sermon consistently places God as the active Subject and humanity as the desperate, incapable Receiver.

indicatoren_moralisme.tekstueel_bewijs: Imagine for a moment that you are the parent...

indicatoren_genade.indicator: God as active Subject of verbs
indicatoren_genade.tekstueel_bewijs: The love that persists in breaking through our resistance
there is no health in us

exemplarisme_check.beschrijving: Human parents/caregivers are used as analogies, but they are explicitly labeled as 'hints' or 'glimmers' of the true Subject (God).
exemplarisme_check.alternatieve_lezing: The sermon already treats Paul not as a hero to imitate, but as a witness to the desperation of grace.

identificatie_patroon.effect_op_hoorder: Relief, humility, and 'renewed confidence' in God rather than self.
identificatie_patroon.theologische_implicatie: Monergistic undertones; salvation is entirely God's work.

narratieve_coherentie.coherentie_beschrijving: The transition from the Trinitarian nature of God to the human need in Psalm 130 is logically linked by the concept of 'self-giving love'.
spanning_punten: The tension between 'miserable offender' and 'beloved child'.

soteriologie.tekstueel_bewijs: God’s love spends itself to the very last drop of the blood of the Son; breaking through our resistance.

pneumatologie.competentie_schenking: The Spirit is the 'fellowship' and the power that 'pours forth'.

hamartologie.ernst_diagnose: Critical; described as 'catastrophe' and 'no health in us'.

aanbevelingen.actantiele_audit_samenvatting: The narrative engine is powered by God's initiative. Humans are actantially 'The Depths' or 'The Receiver'.

modale_balans.voorgestelde_balans: Maintain as is; this is a strong grace-oriented balance.

aanbevelingen.slotopmerking: This sermon is a masterclass in maintaining God as the Subject of the active verbs while taking the human predicament seriously.

comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_retorische_analyse: While a rhetorical analysis would focus on the parental metaphors, semiotics shows these metaphors function to define the 'Sender's' motivation.
comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_exegese: Goes beyond the meaning of 'Trinity' to show how the Trinity functions as the 'Actantial Subject' in the economy of salvation.
comparatieve_analyse.unieke_inzichten_greimas: Reveals that even when the preacher asks the hearer to 'imagine' (Subject: Hearer), the narrative quickly re-centers God as the only one with the 'Pouvoir-faire' to save.

appendices.notities: The sermon successfully avoids the 'Exemplarist' trap by framing human love as a 'glimmer' rather than a 'requirement'.
